definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Distractions and annoyances are plentiful but don’t let the minor things get under your skin.
sentences.chinese: 爲瑣事分心和惱怒很常見，但是不要放在心上。

sentences.english: Other voices, particularly in America, have joined the chorus of dismay.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是在美國，其他的觀點也加入到反分心的合唱中。

sentences.english: The chequered background is a little distracting .
sentences.chinese: 黑白格子的背景是一個小分心。

sentences.english: I think the boy's absent-mindedness accounted much for the accident.
sentences.chinese: 我想那男孩的分心是這次事故的主要因素。

sentences.english: One of the most pleasurable exercises around, uninhibited dancing distracts even the most committed worrier.
sentences.chinese: 跳舞是協助放鬆的愉快運動，連最憂愁的人都會分心。

sentences.english: Hunching over, chatting on your cell, or being distracted by your iPod or text messages make you an easy target for a bad guy.
sentences.chinese: 由聊天或使你分心的短信可以預感到那是一個壞傢伙。

sentences.english: Dudes get distracted easily, we know this.
sentences.chinese: 我們都很瞭解，人都是很容易分心的。

sentences.english: Children'persistence was associated positively with distraction.
sentences.chinese: 注意廣度與持久性與分心正相關顯著。

sentences.english: So one way to beat procrastination is to starve it of distractions.
sentences.chinese: 所以戰勝拖延的一個辦法就是消除分心的事物。

sentences.english: Is distractability always a bad thing?
I owe you this duty and nothing will distract me from it.
sentences.chinese: 這是我對你的一個義務，任何事情都不能讓我分心。

sentences.english: On the test, some hard physics questions made him nervous and distracted, says Mr. Almanza, 18, a senior at Campbell High in Smyrna, Ga.
sentences.chinese: 考試中，一些物理難題讓他緊張分心。

sentences.english: Get the job done because that's what I taught you to do.
sentences.chinese: 不要總是被想念分心，我教你做的就是做好你的工作。

sentences.english: We all have WAY too many distractions every day.
sentences.chinese: 我們每天都要遇到很多分心的事物。

sentences.english: It can also be a source of distraction for vain actors.
sentences.chinese: 此外還將會成爲一些虛榮演員的分心物。

sentences.english: The colours used on the page distracted participants.
sentences.chinese: 網頁上的顏色也會令試驗者分心。

definition: to give attention to sth/please give (some of your valuable) attention to my task/to be distracted
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to take into consideration/to attend to
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
wholeheartedly/(to devote oneself) heart and soul
urgent and important moment (idiom); critical juncture
to concentrate entirely on sth/fully engaged/with full force
